summary: This is a memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a BOP Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The document references attached evidence including emails, logs, and a video screenshot from the time of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; inmate who died while housed at MCC New York.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Mentioned in an attachment regarding overtime worked on August 10, 2019, the day after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Appears as a sender/recipient in an email attachment dated August 18, 2019.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death
events.description: The death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, which is the subject of the OIG investigation.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Specialist
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ OIG conduct a voluntary, recorded interview with a BOP Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist regarding Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
Boston Area Office (DOJ OIG reporting office)
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an official investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York.
A key interview with a BOP Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist was conducted on August 4, 2021, and was recorded and transcribed.
Attached evidence includes emails, daily logs from August 9-10, 2019, a video screenshot from the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and documents referencing staff like Tova Noel.
The document lists an email gap in a BOP inbox showing no emails between August 9 and August 15, 2019, potentially relevant to the investigation timeline.
The memorandum is an internal investigative document containing no recommendations or conclusions, and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
